hints.content: Each tick mark on the number line represents one minute.

$4{:}30$ is $30$ minutes after $4{:}00$. 

![The number line goes from 0 to 60 with marks at every 10 minutes. 0 is labeled 4:00 and 60 is labeled 5:00. Marks divide the space between each number into 10 equal parts. The label 4:30 is at 30.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/f00c8ab29928289f5cc81447a685b7ca9c2b81af) 

So, we move $30$ tick marks past $4{:}00$.

This number line shows $4{:}30$ graphed:

![The number line goes from 0 to 60 with marks at every 10 minutes. 0 is labeled 4:00 and 60 is labeled 5:00. Marks divide the space between each number into 10 equal parts. Point C is labeled at 30.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e26b6d0df3b2fb92930fd21a57d3d635e61a9c2a)

question.content:
**On which number line is $4{:}30$ graphed?**

choices.content: ![The number line goes from 0 to 60 with marks at every 10 minutes. 0 is labeled 4:00 and 60 is labeled 5:00. Marks divide the space between each number into 10 equal parts. Point A is labeled at 5 marks to the right of 30.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0f9ca01e5c8a19ef510c4e87b402582c7ffeac6f)
